Articles.Content:
With hardpoints... my life is now ten times easier. Thank you!

You didn\'t know about them?

You didn\'t know about them?

I knew about them, heard of them but never downloaded them because I couldn\'t find it.

All of these little tricks I have come up to build around the lack of these pieces were so worth it, thats why F2I aircraft will stay at the top of the line. 8)
added a new carrier.
Awesomeness, I love your part pack!

NOOOOOOOOOOOOO :\'(

This video contains content from SME and EMI, one or more of whom have blocked it in your country on copyright grounds.

Sorry about that.

NOOOOOOOOOOOOO :\'(

Dont worry about that, I will upload one without any music, I just threw some on to kinda break down the length of the video
Raw footage up

This is awesome.

I loved your first Carrier and had (read: still having) a lot of fun with it. It took me 15 times before I my my first landing on the deck.

I was like ;D 8)

Now you made it more easy to land on it without that tail and the deck looks awesome.

I was inspired by your carrier designs, the Zephyr is great but has a tiny deck, the Hermes looks fantastic, but too laggy on my laptop :-(

So I made my own!

It needs:

C7 + Experimentals + Hardpoints (click)

HSTW Amphibious Gear (click)

TiberDyne SBS and Aux C7 (for the launch stand, click).

TheMattyPrince\'s flight deck (first post of this thread)

It takes off fairly well and flies OK. A bit tricky to land on water, as it doesn\'t have a good glide ratio, and if you land too hard the bottom engines break off. The jumbo wings separate so it stays in the water. Carrier needs to be travelling just under 50m/s when you take off from it, to make landing again easiest.

It could probably use a few more struts to stop certain deck plates from wobbling, but over all I\'m very pleased with my first carrier :-)
I would love to see someone put a carrier on LAND...

I would love to see someone put a carrier on LAND...

Both of mine are capable of landing on land.

Then will go along on the land too, only problem is that you can hit the little rifts in the ground, and BOOM!

Both of mine are capable of landing on land.

Then will go along on the land too, only problem is that you can hit the little rifts in the ground, and BOOM!

Yea, I was about to say there are no long stretches of land to burn across the plains with time for maneuvering another plane on and off of it.
So...you made flying aircraft carriers... O_o

So...you made flying aircraft carriers... O_o

Kind of... once you land on it it dips down and eventually flies into the terrain.

There is really no way of keeping them in the air with differential contacts with other objects,
this will be awesome to try to attempt to land on now that persistence is here!

this will be awesome to try to attempt to land on now that persistence is here!

Made a persistent carrier. Then it exploded...

Made a persistent carrier. Then it exploded...

You reminded me that I still haven\'t landed on my Shepard I carrier yet! Brb.

wtf man will make a vid of that will ya?

You reminded me that I still haven\'t landed on my Shepard I carrier yet! Brb.

The next big step in mothership designs is a flying aircraft carrier, which I am developing right now.

This will change the game. 8)

That reminds me of this from Ace Combat 6 (large picture)

That reminds me of this from Ace Combat 6 (large picture)

I have seen that picture before, and it gave me inspiration to build this very old atmospheric heavy atmoshperic ship, The Falcon-42AR.

http://img861.imageshack.us/img861/2913/screenshot15f.png

It also helped me build this more recent battlecrusier, the Allium II

http://img190.imageshack.us/img190/7285/screenshot71ge.png
It looks nothing like either of them...

It looks nothing like either of them...

It used too, until I found such unstability with such a wide craft (The AC 6 ship is huge, and mine may look huge, but not as big)

The AC ship is more like the width as a normal carrier is long...

So yeah, that\'d be problematic.

The AC ship is more like the width as a normal carrier is long...

So yeah, that\'d be problematic.

But remember the AC glider design may work in real life; KSP\'s air physics isn\'t too reliable at the moment.

But remember the AC glider design may work in real life; KSP\'s air physics isn\'t too reliable at the moment.

Until C7 releases that plugin he\'s been working on.
